snippet.title: 10 Feminism - How To Be Ava White
snippet.description:
Amber feels that a part of being a good GM is being exposed to different viewpoints and drawing from real experiences in order to create more authentic characters. Because of that, she wanted to try her hand playing a game from the #Feminism  anthology. It’s a collection of nano games written by women that focus on feminist issues. Amber played How to be Ava White by Eva Wei with Kristin and Brandon. This game is about the unrealistic expectations of being a woman. They donned roles of aspects that live in Ava White’s head and debated their fiercely held beliefs. There is a  long debrief after the debate so this episode is about 50% roleplay and 50% talk show.

Disclaimer: The views of the aspects as they are played do not necessarily represent the views of the players.

iTunes: https://itunes.apple.com/us/podcast/shapeshift/id1256535739
Our Website: http://geekspective.com
Patreon: https://www.patreon.com/geekspective
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/geekspective

snippet.title: a'21 :: Ignorant Fairies: New Materialist Queer-Feminist Political Ecological App. :: Öznur Karakaş
snippet.description:
a'21 amberNetworkFestival 
Lecture/Workshop
Ignorant Fairies: New Materialist Queer-Feminist Political Ecological Approaches 
by Öznur Karakaş

In this workshop, we will be studying selected new materialist texts and works of art regarding non-human life, nature and matter in this digital era which also intersects with Anthropocene discussion starting from the beginning of 2000s to better confront the growing 'uncertainty' 'unintelligibility' of non human agency. Plant studies of Natasha Myer, the conception of nature in Staicy Alaimo's queer ecology and nature-culture entanglement in the bio-art works of Marta de Menezes will be discussed within the scope of the larger new materialist, post-human queer-feminist theoretical contributions.  The workshop will include a theoretical part to discuss the place of Nature, Matter and Body in Queer theory with a special emphasis on new materialist critics of Judith Butler's conception of body and performativity. Queer feminist theorists like Stacy Alaimo provide us with valuable tools to reconsider our conception of nature, body and matter in the post-digital world we live in which is gradually more construed around the tendency of dematerialization. Yet, recent discussions on Anthropocene and the growing interest towards developing a political ecology to cope with ramped-up uncertainties of a world afflicted with climate change, and unforeseen viral activities point towards the requirement to re-materialize our ties with the earth. The theoretical part of the workshop will thus give us a chance to reconsider what nature, matter and body signify in in the post-digital world with a special emphasis on Natasha Myer's ""becoming sensor"" project, Stacy Alaimo's queer ecologies and Marta de Menezes' bioart.  It will also include an artistic-practical part where the participants will be instructed to practice Natasha Myer's Sensing Botanical Sensoria: A Kriya For Cultivating Your Inner Plant.

#queerfeminist #ecology #nonhuman 

a'21 amberNetworkFestival 
Post Digital Ignorance
10 March -18 May 2021
https://ambernetworkfestival.org​​​​​​​​


This event is part of  a’21 - Post Digital Ignorance  x Techno Utopia,  #amberNetworkFestival 
The project was financed by Berlin’s Hauptstadtkulturfonds.

a’21 amberNetworkFestival takes place between the 10th of March and 18th of May 2021 at Oyoun in Berlin and in the network nodes amberPlatform (İstanbul), Darağaç (Izmir), New Media society (Tehran), DAH Project (Shiraz), KounAktif (Casablanca), BAAB (Khartoum), Shahraban (Baalbek), Bishkek Contemporary (Bishkek) and ADEF (Cairo, Berlin) currently. 

a’21 amberNetworkFestival is produced by Oyoun Berlin (https://oyoun.de)
and conceived by amberPlatform İstanbul  (https://ambernetworkfestival.org )

snippet.title: I Was Bullied By SJW Twitter Feminist
snippet.description:
A transgendered feminist named Charolette Clymer bullied me on twitter recently over a tweet about Johnny Depp and Amber Heard. I explain what happened.  The feminist, sjw Charlotte Clymer, has a history of bullying people, including women, back when her name was Charles Clymer.  She also bullied Canadian TV personality Ed The Sock over the same issue.  As he said, this is how the left loses.

snippet.title: God's Feminist Movement | Interview with Amber Picota
snippet.description:
Would you be shocked, offended or apathetic if I told you I haven’t had any female guests on the podcast in over 6 years? Yes that’s right, somehow six years have gone by since the last time Fire On Your Head welcomed a female guest. Not because we’re sexist, but like as I explained in the introduction, none of the people I’ve invited on the podcast in recent years have gotten back to me.

We finally break that streak and welcome author of the forthcoming book, God’s Feminist Movement, Amber Picota to the show. We discussed a lot of different things, such as:

-the pros and cons of repurposing blog content into a book,
-the challenges I faced when I published my first Kindle book
-how she scored a book contract with Destiny Image Publishers
-how her time so far in the Welton Academy also led to her going -through the Scripture with a new set of eyes to see things we’re oftentimes conditioned to accept without question.
-God’s Feminist Movement and what it is. We’ve heard a lot of prophetic voices talk about how God is turning the hearts of the fathers to the hearts of the sons, but what about… the mothers?
-Amber shares her powerful testimony
and a lot more...

Join us this week for an in-depth conversation.

Check out Amber's site at AmberPicota.com, and pre-order a copy of her book on Amazon.

Other books mentioned in the show:

Powerful & Free by Danny Silk 

Fashioned to Reign by Kris Vallotton

Normal Christianity by Jonathan Welton

Playing Second Fiddle: God's Heart for Harmony Regarding Women and the Church by Judi Peers

Detailed blog page for this episode: http://stevebremner.com/2016/03/gods-feminist-movement-interview-with-amber-picota/
snippet.tags: ['Amber Picota', "God's Feminist Movement", 'Destiny Image Publisher', 'Interview', 'Steve Bremner']

snippet.title: Expanding Feminism: Collaborations for Social Justice
snippet.description:
This plenary session featuring Ai-jen Poo, Sydnie L. Mosley, Amber Hollibaugh, Ana Oliveira, and moderator Janet Jakobsen was recorded on September 23, 2011 at Activism & the Academy: Celebrating 40 Years of Feminist Scholarship & Action, a conference in honor of the 40th anniversary of the Barnard Center for Research on Women.

Help us caption and translate this video on Amara.org: http://www.amara.org/en/v/B0Gi/

snippet.title: Amber's Feminist Manifesto Hey Men Just Give Up All You Earn While Feminists Continue to Demand More
snippet.description:
Donation Link: https://www.paypal.me/ldghwih
P.O. Box: LDG P.O. Box 731 Cleveland, TX 77328
This week I critique the ideas of a commu.... ahem, feminist manifesto written by Amber Tamblyn for instructions on how men can be better allies for women.  
I don't know about you but I have never needed to wait for any man to help me do what I have always wanted to do, so......now we have this.
Let me know what you think.  

I always have some articles and another fun videos in the works. So Stay tuned and subscribe so you won't miss a thing.

Please consider donating to help me improve and grow my channel to include what you heard:  https://www.paypal.me/ldghwih
No tip too small.

Thanks again for visiting my little acre of the internet and I hope you enjoy my work.  
If you watched my first video, you know that my main goal is to grow my channel so that you can be a part of my show.  
Right now, I am operating on a shoestring with the most primitive of video producing equipment and many many doctor bills, but that is part of my plan to grow and improve as I go.  
I will be so excited when I finally get to add you all to the mix. 
I figure I gotta start somewhere, right?

Not on PP or Wanna send me something? LDG  P.O.Box 731 Cleveland, TX 77328

Follow me here: https://parler.com/profile/HWIH/posts  
Where you can find some of my shorter video posts.

Follow me here: Odysee:  https://odysee.com/@HereswhatIheard:4
Just in case the big YT has a problem with what I say here.

MEWE: https://mewe.com/i/lauradgoddess

MINDS: https://www.minds.com/laurad_goddess/

GAB: https://gab.com/LauraDGoddess

Rumble: https://rumble.com/c/c-316115

SLUG: https://slug.com/member/LauraDGoddess

Odysee:  https://odysee.com/@HereswhatIheard:4


Check out all my videos and help me qualify for monetization. https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCfxubZJb-cnEd2buuRfoaBw 


I will be adding more social networks as we grow.

Following, sharing, Subscribing, commenting, and tipping are all much appreciated. Thanks again for your time and your support.  
Much more to come.   
LDG

snippet.localized.title: Amber's Feminist Manifesto Hey Men Just Give Up All You Earn While Feminists Continue to Demand More
snippet.localized.description:
Donation Link: https://www.paypal.me/ldghwih
P.O. Box: LDG P.O. Box 731 Cleveland, TX 77328
This week I critique the ideas of a commu.... ahem, feminist manifesto written by Amber Tamblyn for instructions on how men can be better allies for women.  
I don't know about you but I have never needed to wait for any man to help me do what I have always wanted to do, so......now we have this.
Let me know what you think.  

I always have some articles and another fun videos in the works. So Stay tuned and subscribe so you won't miss a thing.

Please consider donating to help me improve and grow my channel to include what you heard:  https://www.paypal.me/ldghwih
No tip too small.

Thanks again for visiting my little acre of the internet and I hope you enjoy my work.  
If you watched my first video, you know that my main goal is to grow my channel so that you can be a part of my show.  
Right now, I am operating on a shoestring with the most primitive of video producing equipment and many many doctor bills, but that is part of my plan to grow and improve as I go.  
I will be so excited when I finally get to add you all to the mix. 
I figure I gotta start somewhere, right?

Not on PP or Wanna send me something? LDG  P.O.Box 731 Cleveland, TX 77328

Follow me here: https://parler.com/profile/HWIH/posts  
Where you can find some of my shorter video posts.

Follow me here: Odysee:  https://odysee.com/@HereswhatIheard:4
Just in case the big YT has a problem with what I say here.

Following, sharing, Subscribing, commenting, and tipping are all much appreciated. Thanks again for your time and your support.  
Much more to come.   
LDG
